bag: size and shape (e.g. rectangular, round, tote, backpack)
any unique design or embellishments (e.g. embroidery, beading)
context (e.g. being carried by someone, placed on a surface)
hand_soap: labels or text in Indonesian language
placed near a sink or bathroom area
traditional or natural ingredients (such as coconut or palm oil)
traditional or cultural design elements on packaging.
dustbin: may have a pedal for opening
may have a handle for carrying
may have a label or sign indicating it is a dustbin
may have a specific color or design
may be placed in a designated area for waste disposal
may have visible trash or waste inside
may have a different size or shape compared to other objects
toothbrush: next to toothpaste or toothbrush holder
may have traditional or modern design elements
may have a small cup or container for rinsing
may have a traditional or modern bathroom setting in the background.
toothpaste_toothpowder: toothbrush or finger applying the product
traditional or natural ingredients (such as charcoal or herbs)
common brand in Indonesia (such as Pepsodent or Dentrin)
hairbrush_comb: made of wood, plastic, or metal
bristles or teeth on one side
may have traditional or modern patterns
may be used with or without a mirror
may be seen in a bathroom or dressing area.
chair: made of wood, bamboo, or rattan
may have a small table or footrest attached
may be used for dining or relaxation purposes.
hat: made of straw or woven material
worn by locals or traditional dancers
often paired with traditional clothing or accessories
may have tassels or other embellishments
may have a chin strap or tie to secure it on the head.
light_fixture: may have intricate designs or patterns
may have a switch or cord attached
may be surrounded by other decorative elements such as plants or artwork.
light_switch: usually white or off-white in color
may have a small button or lever
may have text or symbols indicating its function
may have multiple switches in one panel
may have a cover or plate around it
may have a cord or chain attached to it for easy reach
may have a different design or style depending on the region
plate_of_food: use of traditional Indonesian spices and herbs
use of banana leaves as a serving dish
use of traditional Indonesian dishes such as nasi goreng or rendang
presence of side dishes such as sambal or krupuk
use of traditional Indonesian utensils such as a spoon and fork or hands for eating
spices: traditional packaging or containers (baskets, jars, etc.)
labels or names written in Indonesian language
presence of other ingredients or cooking utensils in the photo
traditional cooking methods or techniques being used in the photo (grinding, pounding, etc.)
stove: knobs or buttons for controlling heat
located in a kitchen or outdoor cooking area
cooking_pot: made of clay, metal, or ceramic material
used for cooking over a fire or stove
may have traditional or decorative designs
may be placed on a stand or tripod
may have food or ingredients inside
may be used for communal cooking or serving
may be seen in a kitchen or outdoor cooking area.
cleaning_equipment: person using or holding the equipment
lighter: bright colors (such as red, orange, or yellow)
surrounded by cigarettes or other smoking paraphernalia
medicine: bottles or jars with a lid
candle: surrounded by traditional decorations or offerings
placed on a banana leaf or other natural material
may have a strong scent or smoke
may be part of a religious or cultural ceremony
may be in a temple or outdoor setting
may have intricate carvings or designs on the candle itself.
toy: surrounded by other toys or children playing with it
traditional Indonesian toys such as wayang or angklung.
jug: made of clay or ceramic material
may have a spout or lid
may be used for serving tea or other beverages
may be decorated with traditional Indonesian motifs or symbols.
streetlight_lantern: light bulbs or LED lights attached
mounted on a pole or hanging from a wire
located on the side of a road or pathway
front_door: steps or porch leading up to the door
plants or decorations around the door
presence of shoes or slippers outside the door.
tree: location near water or in a forest setting.
house: traditional Indonesian architecture, such as a thatched roof or intricate carvings
open-air design with large windows or doors
tropical plants or trees surrounding the house
presence of a porch or outdoor seating area
location near a beach or water source
traditional Indonesian symbols or motifs, such as batik patterns or wayang puppets.
backyard: traditional or modern outdoor cooking area
traditional or modern outdoor entertainment area (e.g. gazebo, pergola)
truck: unique design or branding (e.g. traditional patterns or logos)
waste_container: bright colors (such as green, blue, or yellow)
located on the side of the road or in a public area
may have labels or signs indicating it is a waste container
may have visible trash or garbage inside.
car: parked on a road or in a parking lot
surrounded by other cars or buildings
left-hand drive (as Indonesia is a left-hand drive country)
fence: made of wood, bamboo, or metal
may have decorative elements such as carvings or patterns
road_sign: located on the side of the road
may have symbols or images to convey information
may have reflective material for visibility at night
may have multiple signs in one post
may have a specific location or landmark mentioned on the sign.
wheelbarrow: often used for carrying heavy loads
may have a flat or curved bottom
may have a shovel or other tools attached to it
may have colorful decorations or patterns
often seen in outdoor or rural settings
may have plants or other objects inside it.
religious_building: presence of worshippers or religious activities
location in a crowded or busy area
specific building materials such as stone or wood
presence of religious texts or scriptures
stall: located in a market or street
people or vendors standing or sitting in front of it
traditional or cultural elements incorporated in design.
boat: water or waves in the background
fishing nets or equipment on board
people on board wearing traditional Indonesian clothing
other boats or fishing vessels nearby
tropical vegetation or landscape in the background.
monument: located in a public space or park
surrounded by greenery or water features
adorned with flags or symbols of the country
often accompanied by a plaque or sign with information about the monument.
flag: presence of a pole or stand
waving or fluttering in the wind
location, such as on a building or in a public space
size and shape, such as rectangular or triangular
presence of other flags nearby, indicating a national or international event.
bus: colorful exterior with patterns or designs
signage or logos indicating the bus company or route
passengers visible inside or boarding the bus
possible presence of a conductor or driver in the front
location in a busy street or near a bus stop
Indonesian license plate or other identifying markers.
storefront: open storefront with products or displays visible
street vendors or stalls in front of storefront
presence of people or customers entering or exiting the storefront
location in a busy or crowded street or market area
unique cultural elements or decorations on or around the storefront.
bicycle: frame made of metal or bamboo
parked on the side of the road or in a bike rack
surrounded by tropical plants or scenery
possibly ridden by a person wearing traditional Indonesian clothing or a helmet
traditional Indonesian buildings or landmarks in the background.
